intro: Astephanus massonii, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically orange or yellow in color. The plant has opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and ability to thrive in warm climates. Astephanus massonii is also known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested.
